feed.title: twilio's PEAR Channel Server Latest Releases

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.12.5 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Make SIP class PSR-0 compliant

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.12.4 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Add transcription link to recordings

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.12.3 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Add transcription link to recordings

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.12.2 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Fixes issue with string representation of resources

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.12.1 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Support for /Mobile endpoint

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.12.0 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Add support for MMS and Sip In

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.10.0 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Use HTTP status code for error reporting

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.9.1 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Add $last_response attribute to the $client

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.9.0 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Fix TwiML generation for non-ASCII characters

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.8.3 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Fix the ShortCode resource

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.8.2 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Fix an issue where you could not iterate over members of a queue

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.8.1 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Add count() and getNumber() convenience functions

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.8.0 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Support Usage Records and Usage Triggers

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.7.2 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Use a standard CA cert whitelist for SSL validation

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.7.1 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
Fix a bug with URI creation in the 3.5.0 release

entry.title: Services_Twilio 3.7.0 (stable)
entry.content:
A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.

A SDK (or helper library, as we're calling them) for PHP developers to write applications against Twilio's REST API and generate TwiML responses.
